articles.title: OCTOBER 1975
articles.summary: This October 1975 club bulletin provides updates on recent club activities, including the passing of constitutional amendments and a correction regarding comet photo credits. It announces several upcoming events for the month, such as a Space Colonization talk by Dr. Soins, multiple star parties, and a board meeting. The bulletin also reminds members about membership renewal and highlights contributions to the club's library.

articles.title: San Jose Amateur Astronomers
articles.summary: This document presents the 1975-1976 membership list for the San Jose Amateur Astronomers club. It details members' names, addresses, and phone numbers, with an asterisk indicating individuals who have a site release form on file with the club.

articles.title: Directory Listing
articles.summary: This document presents a directory listing of individuals, detailing their names, street addresses, and corresponding phone numbers. The majority of the listed contacts reside in various cities within California, predominantly in the San Jose metropolitan area. Some entries include additional notes or updated contact information.

articles.title: SPACE COLONIZATION
articles.summary: Dr. Richard Reis, Executive Director of the Astronomical Society of the Pacific and editor of Mercury, will deliver a special lecture on space colonization to the San Jose Amateur Astronomers. The talk, scheduled for Friday, October 3, 1975, at 7:30 P.M., will explore space colonies as a concept moving beyond science fiction.
